newsitem.title: USA: CME August pork bellies up limit on buy stops.
newsitem.headline: CME August pork bellies up limit on buy stops.

text.p: CME August pork bellies ran up for a limit gain of 3.000 cents per lb and and July for a near limit gain as buy stops were touched off, traders said.
Bellies were up 2.875 to 1.450 cents with July up 2.525 at 91.550 after reaching 92.000 cents. August was up limit at 90.825 before slipping.
Short covering and other demand prompted by reports packers were planning to cut back on the rate of slaughter lifted prices. Reducing the kill would tighten fresh product offerings, they said.
